title.narrative: 2.2 CHILD-CENTERED POLICIES AND SPENDING EFFICIENCIES INFORMED BY EVIDENCE

description.narrative: Child-centered policies and spending efficiencies informed by evidence and learning, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Making data work for children: Data disaggregated by age, sex, disability, governorate and income are used effectively in planning, monitoring, policy and practice related to children and the Sustainable Development Goals

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 3787 Ruwi Postal Code 112 Muscat

sector.narrative: Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

title.narrative: Oman Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Oman 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child-centered policies and spending efficiencies informed by evidence and learning

description.narrative: A landscape analysis was completed to inform a costing and financing intervention in the areas of early childhood education and integration of children with disabilities in mainstream education. Capacity in Public Finance for Children concepts was built amongst a cross-sectoral group of Government stakeholders. Meanwhile, the Situation Analysis of Children and Women resulted in a better understanding of the programming context to inform ongoing and future interventions. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Public Finance for Children Taskforce Established

target.value: 2020:Score 2 Initiating Initial partnerships established and taskforce being initiated

actual.value: 2020:In progress, initial discussions and identification of focal points.

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

target.value: 2020:Score 2 Intermediate UNICEF has generated evidence to support budget allocation/expenditure, but advocacy has not yet demonstrated improved budget allocation/expenditures

actual.value: 2020:Score 1 Initiating UNICEF is working on generating evidence to support budget allocation/expenditure for child related outcomes

title.narrative: Convening, technical support and partnerships for financing of social services

baseline.value: Score 1: Initiating UNICEF is actively working on identifying and establishing partnerships, or providing technical support to financing of social services for children

target.value: 2020:Score 2: Intermediate UNICEF has established/formalized partnerships to support financing of social services, and provided technical assistance around the issue of financing of social services for children

actual.value: 2020:Score 1: Initiating UNICEF is actively working on identifying and establishing partnerships, or providing technical support to financing of social services for children
